description: Retrieves information about an alarm model. If you don't specify a value for the alarmModelVersion parameter, the latest version is returned.

parameters.name: alarmModelName
parameters.description: The name of the alarm model.

nested_items.name: creationTime
nested_items.description: The time the alarm model was created, in the Unix epoch format.

nested_items.name: alarmModelArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the alarm model. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the AWS General Reference.

nested_items.name: alarmModelVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the alarm model.

nested_items.name: lastUpdateTime
nested_items.description: The time the alarm model was last updated, in the Unix epoch format.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the alarm model. The status can be one of the following values:
ACTIVE - The alarm model is active and it's ready to evaluate data.
ACTIVATING - AWS IoT Events is activating your alarm model. Activating an alarm model can take up to a few minutes.
INACTIVE - The alarm model is inactive, so it isn't ready to evaluate data. Check your alarm model information and update the alarm model.
FAILED - You couldn't create or update the alarm model. Check your alarm model information and try again.

nested_items.name: statusMessage
nested_items.description: Contains information about the status of the alarm model.

nested_items.name: alarmModelName
nested_items.description: The name of the alarm model.

nested_items.name: alarmModelDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the alarm model.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that allows the alarm to perform actions and access AWS resources. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the AWS General Reference.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: An input attribute used as a key to create an alarm. AWS IoT Events routes inputs associated with this key to the alarm.

nested_items.name: severity
nested_items.description: A non-negative integer that reflects the severity level of the alarm.

nested_items.name: alarmRule
nested_items.description: Defines when your alarm is invoked.

nested_items.name: simpleRule
nested_items.description: A rule that compares an input property value to a threshold value with a comparison operator.

nested_items.name: inputProperty
nested_items.description: The value on the left side of the comparison operator. You can specify an AWS IoT Events input attribute as an input property.

nested_items.name: comparisonOperator
nested_items.description: The comparison operator.

nested_items.name: threshold
nested_items.description: The value on the right side of the comparison operator. You can enter a number or specify an AWS IoT Events input attribute.

nested_items.name: alarmNotification
nested_items.description: Contains information about one or more notification actions.

nested_items.name: notificationActions
nested_items.description: Contains the notification settings of an alarm model. The settings apply to all alarms that were created based on this alarm model.

nested_items.name: lambdaAction
nested_items.description: Calls a Lambda function, passing in information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action.

nested_items.name: functionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Lambda function that is executed.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: smsConfigurations
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration information of SMS notifications.

nested_items.name: senderId
nested_items.description: The sender ID.

nested_items.name: additionalMessage
nested_items.description: The message that you want to send. The message can be up to 200 characters.

nested_items.name: recipients
nested_items.description: Specifies one or more recipients who receive the message.

nested_items.name: ssoIdentity
nested_items.description: The AWS Single Sign-On (AWS SSO) authentication information.

nested_items.name: identityStoreId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AWS SSO identity store.

nested_items.name: userId
nested_items.description: The user ID.

nested_items.name: emailConfigurations
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration information of email notifications.

nested_items.name: from
nested_items.description: The email address that sends emails.

nested_items.name: subject
nested_items.description: The subject of the email.

nested_items.name: additionalMessage
nested_items.description: The message that you want to send. The message can be up to 200 characters.

nested_items.name: recipients
nested_items.description: Contains the information of one or more recipients who receive the emails.

nested_items.name: to
nested_items.description: Specifies one or more recipients who receive the email.

nested_items.name: ssoIdentity
nested_items.description: The AWS Single Sign-On (AWS SSO) authentication information.

nested_items.name: identityStoreId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AWS SSO identity store.

nested_items.name: userId
nested_items.description: The user ID.

nested_items.name: alarmEventActions
nested_items.description: Contains information about one or more alarm actions.

nested_items.name: alarmActions
nested_items.description: Specifies one or more supported actions to receive notifications when the alarm state changes.

nested_items.name: targetArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Amazon SNS target where the message is sent.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: iotTopicPublish
nested_items.description: Information required to publish the MQTT message through the AWS IoT message broker.

nested_items.name: mqttTopic
nested_items.description: The MQTT topic of the message. You can use a string expression that includes variables ( $variable.<variable-name>) and input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>) as the topic string.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: functionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Lambda function that is executed.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: iotEvents
nested_items.description: Sends an AWS IoT Events input, passing in information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action.

nested_items.name: inputName
nested_items.description: The name of the AWS IoT Events input where the data is sent.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: queueUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the SQS queue where the data is written.

nested_items.name: useBase64
nested_items.description: Set this to TRUE if you want the data to be base-64 encoded before it is written to the queue. Otherwise, set this to FALSE.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: deliveryStreamName
nested_items.description: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream where the data is written.

nested_items.name: separator
nested_items.description: A character separator that is used to separate records written to the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream. Valid values are: --n' (newline), --t' (tab), --rn' (Windows newline), --,' (comma).

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.
For literal values, the expressions must contain single quotes. For example, the value for the hashKeyType parameter can be 'STRING'.
For references, you must specify either variables or input values. For example, the value for the hashKeyField parameter can be $input.GreenhouseInput.name.

For a substitution template, you must use ${}, and the template must be in single quotes. A substitution template can also contain a combination of literals, operators, functions, references, and substitution templates. In the following example, the value for the hashKeyValue parameter uses a substitution template. '${$input.GreenhouseInput.temperature * 6 / 5 + 32} in Fahrenheit'

For a string concatenation, you must use +. A string concatenation can also contain a combination of literals, operators, functions, references, and substitution templates. In the following example, the value for the tableName parameter uses a string concatenation. 'GreenhouseTemperatureTable ' + $input.GreenhouseInput.date.

nested_items.name: dynamoDBv2
nested_items.description: Defines an action to write to the Amazon DynamoDB table that you created. The default action payload contains all the information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action. You can customize the payload. A separate column of the DynamoDB table receives one attribute-value pair in the payload that you specify.
For literal values, the expressions must contain single quotes. For example, the value for the tableName parameter can be 'GreenhouseTemperatureTable'.
For references, you must specify either variables or input values. For example, the value for the tableName parameter can be $variable.ddbtableName.

For a substitution template, you must use ${}, and the template must be in single quotes. A substitution template can also contain a combination of literals, operators, functions, references, and substitution templates. In the following example, the value for the contentExpression parameter in Payload uses a substitution template. '{\"sensorID\": \"${$input.GreenhouseInput.sensor_id}\", \"temperature\": \"${$input.GreenhouseInput.temperature * 9 / 5 + 32}\"}'

For a string concatenation, you must use +. A string concatenation can also contain a combination of literals, operators, functions, references, and substitution templates. In the following example, the value for the tableName parameter uses a string concatenation. 'GreenhouseTemperatureTable ' + $input.GreenhouseInput.date.

nested_items.name: iotSiteWise
nested_items.description: Sends information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action to a specified asset property in AWS IoT SiteWise.
For literal values, the expressions must contain single quotes. For example, the value for the propertyAlias parameter can be '/company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature'.
For references, you must specify either variables or input values. For example, the value for the assetId parameter can be $input.TurbineInput.assetId1.

For a substitution template, you must use ${}, and the template must be in single quotes. A substitution template can also contain a combination of literals, operators, functions, references, and substitution templates. In the following example, the value for the propertyAlias parameter uses a substitution template. 'company/windfarm/${$input.TemperatureInput.sensorData.windfarmID}/turbine/ ${$input.TemperatureInput.sensorData.turbineID}/temperature'

nested_items.name: alarmCapabilities
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration information of alarm state changes.

nested_items.name: initializationConfiguration
nested_items.description: Specifies the default alarm state. The configuration applies to all alarms that were created based on this alarm model.

nested_items.name: disabledOnInitialization
nested_items.description: The value must be TRUE or FALSE. If FALSE, all alarm instances created based on the alarm model are activated. The default value is TRUE.

nested_items.name: acknowledgeFlow
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to get notified for alarm state changes.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: The value must be TRUE or FALSE. If TRUE, you receive a notification when the alarm state changes. You must choose to acknowledge the notification before the alarm state can return to NORMAL. If FALSE, you won't receive notifications. The alarm automatically changes to the NORMAL state when the input property value returns to the specified range.
